name: Ranger Stevens¹

topics.response_text: Hey, I heard about you. What can I do for you, friend?

topics.topic_text: Nice looking dog you have there.
topics.response_text: Thanks. We haven't been paired together long, but he's a smart dog.
Nope. Haven't noticed anything strange at all. Neither has my friend here, and he has a good nose for these things.

topics.topic_text: Would you mind if I borrowed him to check out the area?
topics.response_text: I don't think so. You already have a dog right there.

topics.topic_text: How do you get his coat so shiny?
topics.response_text: I brush it every day. One hundred brushes.

topics.topic_text: It's okay, I'm good with animals.
topics.response_text: Okay. Take good care of him and bring him back when you're done.

topics.topic_text: Come on, it's just a dog.
topics.response_text: You know what? I think it's best if he stays with me.

topics.topic_text: Thanks for letting me borrow your dog.
topics.response_text: No problem. Glad I could help out.

description:
Ranger Stevens is a 35 year-old Caucasian Male.

A disciplined NCR Ranger stationed at Hoover Dam in preparation for President Kimball's upcoming visit. He can be found patrolling with his loyal dog companion near the visitor center entrance, maintaining a vigilant watch over this strategically vital location.

Ranger Stevens's Personality: Disciplined, professional, and duty-bound. Ranger Stevens takes his responsibilities seriously, showing little patience for wasteland riffraff. He maintains a calm exterior but possesses a fierce loyalty to the NCR and its ideals. While not overtly hostile to outsiders, he expects compliance with NCR regulations.

Ranger Stevens's Backstory: Born and raised in NCR territory, Stevens enlisted in the New California Republic military at 18. After several years of distinguished service, he earned his place among the elite NCR Rangers. Having served multiple tours in the Mojave Wasteland, he's become hardened by the realities of post-war survival while maintaining his commitment to NCR values. His current assignment at Hoover Dam reflects the importance of this strategic location to the NCR's expansion efforts.
